Uses of Interface
ecs.Component

    • Uses of Component in ecs

      Methods in ecs that return Component 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Component Entity.attach​(Component comp)
      Attach a Component to the Entity.
      Component Entity.detach​(java.lang.Class<? extends Component> compClass)
      Detaches a Component from the Entity.
      Component Entity.get​(java.lang.Class<? extends Component> compClass)
      Gets the Component attached to the Entity.
      Component Entity.set​(java.lang.Class<? extends Component> compClass, Component comp)
      Updates the Component associated without notifying the Engine.
      Methods in ecs that return types with arguments of type Component 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.Collection<? extends Component> Entity.allComponents()
      Get all the Components of the Entity.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<? extends Component>> System.getExcluded()
      Gets all the components excluded by the systems.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<? extends Component>> System.getTargets()
      Gets all the components which the systems targets.

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Component Entity.detach​(java.lang.Class<? extends Component> compClass)
      Detaches a Component from the Entity.
      Component Entity.get​(java.lang.Class<? extends Component> compClass)
      Gets the Component attached to the Entity.
      java.util.Collection<Entity> Engine.getEntitiesWithComponent​(java.lang.Class<? extends Component> compClass)
      Gets all the entities having a given Component.
      java.util.Collection<Entity> Engine.getEntitiesWithComponents​(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<? extends Component>> compClasses)
      Gets all the entities having all the given Component.
      boolean Entity.has​(java.lang.Class<? extends Component> compClass)
      Get whether if the Entity has a specified Component.
      boolean Entity.has​(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<? extends Component>> compClasses)
